str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From dokimos; to test; by implication, to approve.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve. Probably from airo; to be agreeable.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: From dokimos; to test; by implication, to approve.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
